result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Bruce Wallace Stovall

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: 16CM147, 16CM176 and 16CT27 Defendant Bruce Wallace Stovall in court with attorney Mark L Perrine.  Kelly J Mcknight appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DA - agreement.  16CT27:  G/NC to count 1 - 16CM176 - G/NC to Counts 2,3,4 remaining counts as well as 16CM147 DRI; parties jr:  16CT27 - Count 3 16CM176 Count 4:  300 fine plus costs 16CM172:  10 days jail and 10 costs and provide a DNA sample.  16CT27  Plead no contest to those four counts.  16CM147:  Dismissed and read in,  16CM176 - Count 1 - DRI.      Court accepts pleas of no contest and finds guilty:  16CT27, OAR - 16CM176, OAR, MBJ, Failure to Install IID.    3 days sentence credit.  Financial oblig - allowed to make payments at rate of 25/00 month.  Sentence:  Count 2,  Count 3 in  16CM176 10 fine 488.88 each count,  16CT27 - Ct 4 - 300 fine plus costs 872.55.  Count 2 of 16176 10 days jail - 488.88 CTS 3 days - wr, child release, good time, contact jail within 7 days, provide a dna spec, EACH CASE set up exact date and time to begin serving jail time and serve no later than Sunday Feb 12, 2017 at 9. Payment proposal accepted by the court.  1 pp of 25 per month next payment due on or before January 23, 2017.  Refer to PQ - court accepts in entirety.

Attorney Mark L Perrine in court.  Kelly J Mcknight appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 16CM147,16CM176,16CT27. Def is not here. Atty comments there is an agreement def told atty might be late because of bus schd., but atty does not think this late. no auth in cases. 16CT27 auth in that case. Ct will set pleas then revoke auth. All cases. the one auth revoked. must appear in person.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 21, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Bruce Wallace Stovall in court with attorney Mark L Perrine.  Ruth Diane Kressel appeared for the State of Wisconsin. there was an agreement in all 3 cases. Atty now comments asks for adjment.  Status conference scheduled for December 12, 2016 at 10:30 am.
Def appeared, Mark L. Perrine appeared, KJM appeared.  Settlement agreement on all three cases going to happen.  Status conference set for 11-21-2016 at 1:45 p.m.

Defendant Bruce Wallace Stovall in court with attorney Mark L Perrine.  Ruth Diane Kressel appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Cases 16CM147,176, 16CT27. Atty Perrine represents def in all cases. Atty Perrine does not have auth on all cases. 16CM176 bail, ADA comments cash bail, no operation w/o valid lic or IID. Atty Perrine request SB. $1000 SB no operate mv w/o valid lic, IID or insurance, booking. Bond given to ACJ report w/in 2 weeks to sign and get booked in  Status conference scheduled for October 17, 2016 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Bruce Wallace Stovall in court by phone with attorney Mark L Perrine appr in person.  Ruth Diane Kressel appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Cases 16CM147 and 16CT27. 16CM147 waives reading and stands mute, requests STC.  DAP. ADA comments on bail, high SB condition not operate MV w/o lic.  Atty Perrine comments. $750 SB not operate MV w/o valid lic-bond given to atty return w/in 10 days  Status conference scheduled for September 26, 2016 at 01:45 pm.
